title: How CS Lewis' Conversion Anticipated the Jordan Peterson Revival
description:
CS Lewis abandoned Christianity in his youth. After he was established in Oxford he began to believe with the help of JRR Tolkien. Their interest in mythology and Christianity as "the true myth" changed CS Lewis' life completely. It was the emphasis on meaning that, like those listening to Jordan Peterson, brought Lewis to consider Christianity and made him into the most effective apologist in the 20th century English speaking world. 

Alister McGrath's biography of Lewis https://www.amazon.com/C-S-Lewis-Eccentric-Reluctant-ebook/dp/B008PX0GPI

Alan Jacob's biography of Lewis https://www.amazon.com/Narnian-Life-Imagination-C-Lewis-ebook/dp/B000FCKH7O/ 

CS Lewis Mere Christianity https://www.amazon.com/Mere-Christianity-Lewis-Signature-Classics-ebook/dp/B002BD2UR0 

George Marsden's "biography" of Mere Christianity https://www.amazon.com/Lewiss-Mere-Christianity-Biography-Religious-ebook/dp/B017I2M87K 

The Fellowship (of the Inklings) https://www.amazon.com/Fellowship-Literary-Inklings-Barfield-Williams-ebook/dp/B00PF6QL1G/
